result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is ordered in the amount of $6890.56 to be paid to Community Financial.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages, during any period of ES.  To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Community Financial.

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.

Defendant Robert E Burns in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Robert E Burns in custody.   Student Intern Kathryn Ginsberg under the student practice rule supervised by Assistant District Attorney Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 254 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

The Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period for 2 years.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Community Financial.
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $6890.56 to be paid to Community Financial.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages, during any period of ES.  To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given. 
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Robert E Burns in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Robert E Burns in custody.  Student Intern Kathryn Ginsberg under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.   Statements by the state, defense and defendant.    Court ordered case adjourned for continued sentencing in Branch 26.    Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Robert E Burns not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Court now in trial as a result of a spin speedy trial taken from Branch 30.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Robert E Burns in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Robert E Burns in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like to proceed with a projected guilty plea.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert E Burns in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Robert E Burns in custody.  James C Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defense counsel newly appointed, requests an adjournment of the trial.  No objection from the state.  The Court grants the adjournment and orders case adjourned for final pretrial conference and jury trial in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant Robert E Burns not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea hearing.  Defense counsel requests jury trial date.    Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  Filed, signed Felony Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
received and filed.

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant Robert E Burns not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea hearing.  Defense counsel needs an offer and requests new date.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant Robert E Burns not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert E Burns in court with attorney Zachary Hoff for Chelsea Williamson.  Defendant Robert E Burns in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Defense counsel requests scheduling conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
filed.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant Robert E Burns not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for an arraignment.  Court is down.    Case adjourned for arraignment in Branch 26.  Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert E Burns in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Defendant Robert E Burns in custody.  James Frisch for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Arraignment scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert E Burns in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Robert E Burns in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert E Burns
Current: 2427 N 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 10-22-2015)
Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Robert E Burns not in court.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
